files.name: .env.example
files.content:
# Server
BACKEND_PORT="11966"
FRONTEND_PORT="18966"
ALLOWED_DOMAINS=""
# APIs
BING_MAP_API_KEY=""
GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY=""
IPINFO_API_TOKEN=""
KEYCDN_USER_AGENT=""
CLOUDFLARE_API=""
IPAPIIS_API_KEY=""
IPCHECKING_API_KEY=""
MAC_LOOKUP_API_KEY=""
# Security related
SECURITY_BLACKLIST_LOG_FILE_PATH=""
SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT=""
SECURITY_DELAY_AFTER=""
# Google Analytics
VITE_GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_ID=""
# CURL API
VITE_CURL_IPV4_DOMAIN=""
VITE_CURL_IPV6_DOMAIN=""
VITE_CURL_IPV64_DOMAIN=""

files.name: CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
files.content:
# Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our
community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender
identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status,
nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity
and orientation.

We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming,
diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our
community include:

* Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
* Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
* Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
* Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes,
  and learning from the experience
* Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the
  overall community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

* The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or
  advances of any kind
* Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
* Public or private harassment
* Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or email
  address, without their explicit permission
* Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
  professional setting

## Enforcement Responsibilities

Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of
acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in
response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive,
or harmful.

Community leaders have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject
comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are
not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation
decisions when appropriate.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when
an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces.
Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address,
posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
representative at an online or offline event.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at
.
All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.

All community leaders are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the
reporter of any incident.

## Enforcement Guidelines

Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining
the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:

### 1. Correction

**Community Impact**: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed
unprofessional or unwelcome in the community.

**Consequence**: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing
clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the
behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.

### 2. Warning

**Community Impact**: A violation through a single incident or series
of actions.

**Consequence**: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No
interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with
those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This
includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels
like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or
permanent ban.

### 3. Temporary Ban

**Community Impact**: A serious violation of community standards, including
sustained inappropriate behavior.

**Consequence**: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public
communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or
private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction
with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period.
Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.

### 4. Permanent Ban

**Community Impact**: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community
standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior,  harassment of an
individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals.

**Consequence**: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within
the community.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage],
version 2.0, available at
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html.

Community Impact Guidelines were inspired by [Mozilla's code of conduct
enforcement ladder](https://github.com/mozilla/diversity).

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see the FAQ at
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations are available at
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

files.name: CONTRIBUTING.md
files.content:
# CONTRIBUTING.md

## Welcome Contributors! üëã

We're delighted that you're interested in contributing to our project! This document provides guidelines to ensure a smooth contribution process for everyone involved.

### Table of Contents

- [CONTRIBUTING.md](#contributingmd)
  - [Welcome Contributors! üëã](#welcome-contributors-)
    - [Table of Contents](#table-of-contents)
    - [Code of Conduct](#code-of-conduct)
    - [Getting Started](#getting-started)
    - [Reporting Bugs](#reporting-bugs)
    - [Feature Requests](#feature-requests)
    - [Submitting Changes](#submitting-changes)
    - [Setting Up Your Environment](#setting-up-your-environment)
    - [Testing](#testing)
    - [Pull Request Guidelines](#pull-request-guidelines)
    - [Code Review Process](#code-review-process)
    - [Community and Support](#community-and-support)
  - [Thank You! üëè](#thank-you-)

### Code of Conduct

This project adheres to a [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). By participating, you are expected to uphold this code.

### Getting Started

If you're new to the project, consider:

- Reading the project's README for an overview.
- Checking the issues labeled as `good first issue` for an easy entry point.

### Reporting Bugs

Please follow the bug report template provided in [BUG_REPORT_TEMPLATE.md](.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md). Include terminal and console logs for a comprehensive report.

### Feature Requests

We love to hear your ideas! Open an issue with the tag `feature request` and provide a clear and detailed explanation of the feature and its benefits.

### Submitting Changes

Before making any changes, please:

1. Open a new issue discussing your proposed change.
2. Fork the repository and make your changes in a new branch.

### Setting Up Your Environment

To set up the development environment for this project, you'll need to:

1. Install Node.js, Vite, and Vue3.
2. Clone the repository.
3. Run `npm install` to install dependencies.
4. Follow the instructions for Docker and Vercel deployment in our documentation if necessary.

### Testing

Ensure that all tests pass and, if applicable, add new tests for your changes. Run `npm test` to execute tests.

### Pull Request Guidelines

When you're ready to submit your changes:

1. Rebase your branch to the latest `dev` branch.
2. Ensure your changes adhere to the coding standards and guidelines.
3. Submit a pull request with a clear description of your changes.

### Code Review Process

The project maintainers will review your pull request. They might request changes or provide feedback before merging.

### Community and Support

Join our community channels (link your channels here) for support and discussions.

## Thank You! üëè

Your contributions are what make this community great. We appreciate your efforts in making this project better!

files.name: Dockerfile
files.content:
# Á¨¨‰∏ÄÈò∂ÊÆµÔºöÊûÑÂª∫
FROM node:20-alpine as build-stage
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm install
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

# Á¨¨‰∫åÈò∂ÊÆµÔºöËøêË°å
FROM node:20-alpine as production-stage
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=build-stage /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=build-stage /app/package.json ./
COPY --from=build-stage /app/dist ./dist
COPY --from=build-stage /app/backend-server.js ./
COPY --from=build-stage /app/frontend-server.js ./
COPY --from=build-stage /app/api ./api
COPY --from=build-stage /app/common ./common

EXPOSE 18966

# ÂêØÂä®Â∫îÁî®
CMD ["npm", "start"]

files.name: README.md
files.content:
# üß∞ MyIP - A Better IP Toolbox
![IPCheck.ing Banner](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/main/public/github/gh_banner.png) [![Mentioned in Awesome Self Hosted](https://awesome.re/mentioned-badge.svg)](https://github.com/awesome-selfhosted/awesome-selfhosted) ![GitHub Repo stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/jason5ng32/MyIP) ![GitHub forks](https://img.shields.io/github/forks/jason5ng32/myip) ![Docker Pulls](https://img.shields.io/docker/pulls/jason5ng32/myip) [![Website](https://img.shields.io/website?url=https%3A%2F%2Fipcheck.ing&up_message=online&label=IPCheck.ing 'IPCheck.ing')](https://ipcheck.ing) ![PWA](https://img.shields.io/badge/PWA-Supported-blue) ![CodeQL](https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/actions/workflows/github-code-scanning/codeql/badge.svg?branch=main) ![Docker Build and Push](https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/actions/workflows/docker-image.yml/badge.svg?branch=main) üá∫üá∏ [English](README.md) | üá®üá≥ [ÁÆÄ‰Ωì‰∏≠Êñá](README_ZH.md) | üá´üá∑ [Fran√ßais](README_FR.md) üëâ Demo: [https://ipcheck.ing](https://ipcheck.ing) Feel free to bookmark the demo or deploy your own. [![Deploy with Docker](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/main/public/github/Docker.svg)](https://hub.docker.com/r/jason5ng32/myip)
## üëÄ Main Features * üõú **View Your IPs**: Detects and displays your local IPs, sourcing from multiple IPv4 and IPv6 providers. * üîç **Search IP Information**: Provides a tool for querying information about any IP address. * üïµÔ∏è **IP Information**: Presents detailed information for all IP addresses, including country, region, ASN, geographic location, and more. * üö¶ **Availability Check**: Tests the accessibility of various websites, such as Google, GitHub, YouTube, ChatGPT, and others. * üö• **WebRTC Detection**: Identifies the IP address used during WebRTC connections. * üõë **DNS Leak Test**: Shows DNS endpoint data to evaluate the risk of DNS leaks when using VPNs or proxies. * üöÄ **Speed Test**ÔºöTest your network speed with edge networks. * üöè **Proxy Rule Testing**: Test the rule settings of proxy software to ensure their correctness. * ‚è±Ô∏è **Global Latency Test**: Performe lantency tests on servers located in different regions around the world. * üì° **MTR Test**: Perform MTR tests on servers located in different regions around the world. * üî¶ **DNS Resolver**: Performs DNS resolution of a domain name from multiple sources and obtains real-time resolution results that can be used for contamination determination. * üöß **Censorship Check**: Check if a website is blocked in some countries. * üìì **Whois Search**: Perform whois information search for domain names or IP addresses * üìÄ **MAC Lookup**: Query information of a physical address * üñ•Ô∏è **Browser Fingerprints**ÔºöMultiple ways to caculate your browser fingerprint * üìã **Cybersecurity Checklist**ÔºöA comprehensive cybersecurity checklist with a total of 258 items ## üí™ Also * üåó **Dark Mode**: Automatically toggles between dark and daylight modes based on system settings, with an option for manual switching. * üì± **Minimalist Mode**: A mobile-optimized mode that shortens page length for quick access to essential information.. * üì≤ **PWA Supported**ÔºöCan be added as a desktop app on your phone as well as a Chrome app on your computer. * ‚å®Ô∏è **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Supports keyboard shortcuts for all functions, press `?` to view the shortcut list. * üåç Based on availability test results, it indicates whether global internet access is currently feasible. * üá∫üá∏ üá®üá≥ üá´üá∑ English, Chinese, and French support. ## üìï How to Use ### Deploying in a Node Environment Make sure you have Node.js installed. Clone the code: ```bash git clone https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP.git ``` Install and build: ```bash npm install && npm run build ``` Run: ```bash npm start ``` The program will run on port 18966. ### Using Docker Click the 'Deploy to Docker' button at the top to complete the deployment. Or, use the following shell: ```bash docker run -d -p 18966:18966 --name myip --restart always jason5ng32/myip:latest ``` ## üìö Environment Variable You can use the program without adding any environment variables, but if you want to use some advanced features, you can add the following environment variables: | Variable Name | Required | Default Value | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `BACKEND_PORT` | No | `"11966"` | The running port of the backend part of the program | | `FRONTEND_PORT` | No | `"18966"` | The running port of the frontend part of the program | | `SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT` | No | `"0"` | Controls the number of requests an IP can make to the backend server every 60 minutes (set to 0 for no limit) | | `SECURITY_DELAY_AFTER` | No | `"0"` | Controls the first X requests from an IP every 20 minutes that are not subject to speed limits, and after X requests, the delay will increase | | `SECURITY_BLACKLIST_LOG_FILE_PATH` | No | `"logs/blacklist-ip.log"` | Path setting. Records the list of IPs that triggered the limit after SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT is enabled | | `GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY=` | No | `""` | API Key for Google Maps, used to display the location of the IP on a map | | `ALLOWED_DOMAINS` | No | `""` | Allowed domains for access, separated by commas, used to prevent misuse of the backend API | | `IPCHECKING_API_KEY` | No | `""` | API Key for IPCheck.ing, used to obtain accurate IP geolocation information | | `IPINFO_API_TOKEN` | No | `""` | API Token for IPInfo.io, used to obtain IP geolocation information through IPInfo.io | | `IPAPIIS_API_KEY` | No | `""` | API Key for IPAPI.is, used to obtain IP geolocation information through IPAPI.is | | `KEYCDN_USER_AGENT` | No | `""` | The domain name when using KeyCDN, must contain https prefix. Used to obtain IP address information through KeyCDN | | `CLOUDFLARE_API` | No | `""` | API Key for Cloudflare, used to obtain AS system information through Cloudflare | | `MAC_LOOKUP_API_KEY` | No | `""` | API Key for MAC Lookup, used to obtain MAC address information | | `VITE_GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_ID` | **Yes** | `""` | Google Analytics ID, used to track user behavior | | `VITE_CURL_IPV4_DOMAIN` | No | `""` | Provides the IPv4 domain for the CURL API to users | | `VITE_CURL_IPV6_DOMAIN` | No | `""` | Provides the IPv6 domain for the CURL API to users | | `VITE_CURL_IPV64_DOMAIN` | No | `""` | Provides the dual-stack domain for the CURL API to users | Note that if any of the CURL series environment variables are missing, the CURL API will not be enabled. ### Using Environment Variables in a Node Environment Create environment variables: ```bash cp .env.example .env ``` Modify `.env`, and for example, add the following: ```bash BACKEND_PORT=11966 FRONTEND_PORT=18966 GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY="YOUR_KEY_HERE" ALLOWED_DOMAINS="example.com" IPCHECKING_API="YOUR_KEY_HERE" ``` Then restart the backend service. ### Using Environment Variables in Docker You can add environment variables when running Docker, for example: ```bash docker run -d -p 18966:18966 \ -e GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY="YOUR_KEY_HERE" \ -e ALLOWED_DOMAINS="example.com" \ -e IPCHECKING_API="YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" \ --name myip \ jason5ng32/myip:latest ``` ## üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Advanced Usage If you're using a proxy for internet access, consider adding this rule to your proxy configuration (modify it according to your client). This setup lets you check both your real IP and the IP when using the proxy: ```ini # IP Testing IP-CIDR,1.0.0.1/32,Proxy,no-resolve IP-CIDR6,2606:4700:4700::1111/128,Proxy,no-resolve DOMAIN,4.ipcheck.ing,DIRECT DOMAIN,6.ipcheck.ing,DIRECT # Rule Testing DOMAIN,ptest-1.ipcheck.ing,Proxy1 DOMAIN,ptest-2.ipcheck.ing,Proxy2 DOMAIN,ptest-3.ipcheck.ing,Proxy3 DOMAIN,ptest-4.ipcheck.ing,Proxy4 DOMAIN,ptest-5.ipcheck.ing,Proxy5 DOMAIN,ptest-6.ipcheck.ing,Proxy6 DOMAIN,ptest-7.ipcheck.ing,Proxy7 DOMAIN,ptest-8.ipcheck.ing,Proxy8 ``` ## üò∂‚Äçüå´Ô∏è Additional Notes When version 2.0 was released, I said that 70% of the code for this program was not written by me, but by ChatGPT. After about 90 interactions, plus some minor manual adjustments, the entire codebase was completed. Of course, the architecture and UI still required my own design. With the release of version 3.0 and subsequent versions, the proportion of code written with the help of ChatGPT has gradually decreased, now estimated to be between 40% and 50%. On the contrary, in this process, I went from having no knowledge of JavaScript and Vue to being able to understand most of the JS code, and I can now write some on my own. Thanks to AI, it has given me, an unemployed product manager, a rapid opportunity to learn programming. ## üåü Star History [![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=jason5ng32/MyIP&type=Date)](https://star-history.com/#jason5ng32/MyIP&Date)

files.name: README_FR.md
files.content:
# üß∞ MyIP - Une meilleure bo√Æte √† outils IP
![IPCheck.ing Banner](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/main/public/github/gh_banner.png) [![Mentioned in Awesome Self Hosted](https://awesome.re/mentioned-badge.svg)](https://github.com/awesome-selfhosted/awesome-selfhosted) ![GitHub Repo stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/jason5ng32/MyIP) ![GitHub forks](https://img.shields.io/github/forks/jason5ng32/myip) ![Docker Pulls](https://img.shields.io/docker/pulls/jason5ng32/myip) [![Website](https://img.shields.io/website?url=https%3A%2F%2Fipcheck.ing&up_message=online&label=IPCheck.ing 'IPCheck.ing')](https://ipcheck.ing) ![PWA](https://img.shields.io/badge/PWA-Supported-blue) ![CodeQL](https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/actions/workflows/github-code-scanning/codeql/badge.svg?branch=main) ![Docker Build and Push](https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/actions/workflows/docker-image.yml/badge.svg?branch=main) üá∫üá∏ [English](README.md) | üá®üá≥ [ÁÆÄ‰Ωì‰∏≠Êñá](README_ZH.md) | üá´üá∑ [Fran√ßais](README_FR.md) üëâ D√©mo: [https://ipcheck.ing](https://ipcheck.ing) Notes: Vous pouvez utiliser ma d√©mo gratuitement et vous pouvez √©galement la d√©ployer vous-m√™me. [![Deploy with Docker](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/main/public/github/Docker.svg)](https://hub.docker.com/r/jason5ng32/myip)
## üëÄ Principales fonctionnalit√©s * üõú **Afficher vos adresses IP** : D√©tecte et affiche votre adresse IP locale, provenant de plusieurs fournisseurs IPv4 et IPv6. * üîç **Recherche d'informations sur l'adresse IP** : Fournit un outil pour interroger des informations sur n'importe quelle adresse IP. * üïµÔ∏è **Informations sur l'adresse IP** : Pr√©sente des informations d√©taill√©es pour toutes les adresses IP, y compris le pays, la r√©gion, l'ASN, la localisation g√©ographique, et plus encore. * üö¶ **V√©rification de disponibilit√©** : Teste l'accessibilit√© de diff√©rents sites web, tels que Google, GitHub, YouTube, ChatGPT, et d'autres. * üö• **D√©tection WebRTC** : Identifie l'adresse IP utilis√©e lors des connexions WebRTC. * üõë **Test de fuite DNS** : Affiche les donn√©es de point de terminaison DNS pour √©valuer le risque de fuites DNS lors de l'utilisation de VPN ou de proxies. * üöÄ **Test de vitesse** : Testez la vitesse de votre r√©seau avec des r√©seaux de pointe. * üöè **Test de r√®gles** : Teste si les param√®tres de r√®gles fonctionnent correctement avec le logiciel de proxy. * ‚è±Ô∏è **Test de latence mondiale** : Effectue des tests de latence sur des serveurs situ√©s dans diff√©rentes r√©gions du monde. * üì° **Test MTR** : Effectue des tests MTR sur des serveurs situ√©s dans diff√©rentes r√©gions du monde. * üî¶ **R√©solveur DNS** : effectue la r√©solution DNS d'un nom de domaine √† partir de plusieurs sources, obtient les r√©sultats de la r√©solution en temps r√©el et peut √™tre utilis√© pour la d√©termination de la contamination. * üöß **Test de Censorship**: V√©rifier si un site est bloqu√© dans certains pays. * üìì **Recherche Whois** : Effectuer une recherche d'informations Whois pour les noms de domaine ou les adresses IP * üìÄ **Recherche MAC** : Requ√™te d'informations d'une adresse physique * üñ•Ô∏è **Empreinte digitale du navigateur**: Plusieurs fa√ßons de visualiser l'empreinte digitale de votre navigateur * üìã **Liste de contr√¥le de cybers√©curit√©**Ôºö: Une liste de contr√¥le compl√®te de la cybers√©curit√© avec un total de 258 √©l√©ments ## üí™√âgalement * üåó **Mode sombre** : Bascule automatiquement entre les modes sombre et clair en fonction des param√®tres du syst√®me, avec une option de basculement manuel. * üì± **Mode minimaliste** : Un mode optimis√© pour les mobiles qui r√©duit la longueur de la page pour un acc√®s rapide aux informations essentielles. * üì≤ **Prise en charge de PWA** : Peut √™tre ajout√© en tant qu'application de bureau sur votre t√©l√©phone ainsi qu'en tant qu'application Chrome sur votre ordinateur. * ‚å®Ô∏è **Raccourcis clavier** : Prend en charge les raccourcis clavier pour toutes les fonctions, appuyez sur `?` pour afficher la liste des raccourcis. * üåç Bas√© sur les r√©sultats des tests de disponibilit√©, il indique si l'acc√®s Internet mondial est actuellement r√©alisable. * üá∫üá∏ üá®üá≥ üá´üá∑ Prise en charge de l'anglais, du chinois et du fran√ßais. ## üìï Comment utiliser ### D√©ploiement dans un environnement Node Assurez-vous d'avoir Node.js install√©. Clonez le code : ```bash git clone https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP.git ``` Installer & Construire : ```bash npm install && npm run build ``` Ex√©cuter: ```bash npm start ``` Le programme s'ex√©cutera sur le port 18966. ### Using Docker Cliquez sur le bouton 'D√©ployer sur Docker' en haut pour terminer le d√©ploiement. Ou utilisez le shell suivant : ```bash docker run -d -p 18966:18966 --name myip --restart always jason5ng32/myip:latest ``` ## üìö Variables d'environnement Vous pouvez utiliser le programme sans ajouter de variables d'environnement, mais si vous souhaitez utiliser certaines fonctionnalit√©s avanc√©es, vous pouvez ajouter les variables d'environnement suivantes : | Nom de la variable | Requis | Valeur par d√©faut | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `BACKEND_PORT` | Non | `"11966"` | Le port d'ex√©cution de la partie backend du programme | | `FRONTEND_PORT` | Non | `"18966"` | Le port d'ex√©cution de la partie frontend du programme | | `SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT` | Non | `"0"` | Contr√¥le le nombre de requ√™tes qu'une adresse IP peut faire au serveur backend toutes les 60 minutes (r√©gl√© sur 0 pour aucune limite) | | `SECURITY_DELAY_AFTER` | Non | `"0"` | Contr√¥le les premi√®res X requ√™tes d'une adresse IP toutes les 20 minutes qui ne sont pas soumises √† des limites de vitesse, et apr√®s X requ√™tes, le d√©lai augmentera | | `SECURITY_BLACKLIST_LOG_FILE_PATH` | Non | `"logs/blacklist-ip.log"` | Param√®tre de chemin. Enregistre la liste des adresses IP qui ont d√©clench√© la limite apr√®s que `SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT` soit activ√© | | `GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY` | Non | `""` | Cl√© API pour Google Maps, utilis√©e pour afficher l'emplacement de l'adresse IP sur une carte | | `ALLOWED_DOMAINS` | Non | `""` | Domaines autoris√©s pour l'acc√®s, s√©par√©s par des virgules, utilis√©s pour emp√™cher une utilisation abusive de l'API backend | | `IPCHECKING_API_KEY` | Non | `""` | Cl√© API pour IPCheck.ing, utilis√©e pour obtenir des informations de g√©olocalisation pr√©cises sur l'adresse IP | | `IPINFO_API_TOKEN` | Non | `""` | Jeton API pour IPInfo.io, utilis√© pour obtenir des informations de g√©olocalisation sur l'adresse IP via IPInfo.io | | `IPAPIIS_API_KEY` | Non | `""` | Cl√© API pour IPAPI.is, utilis√©e pour obtenir des informations de g√©olocalisation sur l'adresse IP via IPAPI.is | | `KEYCDN_USER_AGENT` | Non | `""` | Le nom de domaine lorsque vous utilisez KeyCDN, doit contenir le pr√©fixe https. Utilis√© pour obtenir des informations sur l'adresse IP via KeyCDN | | `CLOUDFLARE_API` | Non | `""` | Cl√© API pour Cloudflare, utilis√©e pour obtenir des informations sur le syst√®me AS via Cloudflare | | `MAC_LOOKUP_API_KEY` | Non | `""` | Cl√© API pour MAC Lookup, utilis√©e pour obtenir des informations sur l'adresse MAC via MAC Lookup | | `VITE_GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_ID` | **Oui** | `""` | Identifiant Google Analytics, utilis√© pour l'analyse des utilisateurs | | `VITE_CURL_IPV4_DOMAIN` | Non | `""` | Fournit aux utilisateurs le domaine IPv4 pour l'API CURL | | `VITE_CURL_IPV6_DOMAIN` | Non | `""` | Fournit aux utilisateurs le domaine IPv6 pour l'API CURL | | `VITE_CURL_IPV64_DOMAIN` | Non | `""` | Fournit aux utilisateurs le domaine √† pile double pour l'API CURL | Il est √† noter que si l'une quelconque des variables d'environnement de la s√©rie CURL est manquante, l'API CURL ne sera pas activ√©e. ### Utilisation des variables d'environnement dans un environnement Node Cr√©ez les variables d'environnement : ```bash cp .env.example .env ``` Modifiez le fichier `.env`, et par exemple, ajoutez ce qui suit : ```bash BACKEND_PORT=11966 FRONTEND_PORT=18966 GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY="YOUR_KEY_HERE" ALLOWED_DOMAINS="example.com" IPCHECKING_API="YOUR_KEY_HERE" ``` Ensuite, red√©marrez le service backend. ### Utilisation des variables d'environnement dans Docker Vous pouvez ajouter des variables d'environnement lors de l'ex√©cution de Docker, par exemple : ```bash docker run -d -p 18966:18966 \ -e GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY="YOUR_KEY_HERE" \ -e ALLOWED_DOMAINS="example.com" \ -e IPCHECKING_API="YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" \ --name myip \ jason5ng32/myip:latest ``` ## üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Utilisation avanc√©e Si vous utilisez un proxy pour acc√©der √† Internet, envisagez d'ajouter cette r√®gle √† votre configuration de proxy (modifiez-la en fonction de votre client). Cette configuration vous permet de v√©rifier √† la fois votre v√©ritable adresse IP et l'adresse IP lorsque vous utilisez le proxy : ```ini # Test d'adresse IP IP-CIDR,1.0.0.1/32,Proxy,no-resolve IP-CIDR6,2606:4700:4700::1111/128,Proxy,no-resolve DOMAIN,4.ipcheck.ing,DIRECT DOMAIN,6.ipcheck.ing,DIRECT # Rule Testing DOMAIN,ptest-1.ipcheck.ing,Proxy1 DOMAIN,ptest-2.ipcheck.ing,Proxy2 DOMAIN,ptest-3.ipcheck.ing,Proxy3 DOMAIN,ptest-4.ipcheck.ing,Proxy4 DOMAIN,ptest-5.ipcheck.ing,Proxy5 DOMAIN,ptest-6.ipcheck.ing,Proxy6 DOMAIN,ptest-7.ipcheck.ing,Proxy7 DOMAIN,ptest-8.ipcheck.ing,Proxy8 ``` ## üò∂‚Äçüå´Ô∏è Explications suppl√©mentaires Lors de la sortie de la version 2.0, j'avais dit que 70% du code de ce programme n'√©tait pas de moi, mais √©crit par ChatGPT. Apr√®s environ 90 interactions, plus quelques ajustements manuels mineurs, tout le code a √©t√© compl√©t√©. Bien s√ªr, l'architecture et l'UI n√©cessitaient toujours ma propre conception. Avec la sortie de la version 3.0 et des versions ult√©rieures, la proportion de code √©crit avec l'aide de ChatGPT a progressivement diminu√©, maintenant estim√©e entre 40% et 50%. Au contraire, dans ce processus, je suis pass√© de ne rien savoir sur JavaScript et Vue √† pouvoir comprendre la plupart des codes JS, et maintenant je peux m√™me en √©crire moi-m√™me. Merci √† l'IA, qui m'a donn√©, √† moi, un chef de produit au ch√¥mage, une opportunit√© rapide d'apprendre la programmation. ## üåü Historique des √©toiles [![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=jason5ng32/MyIP&type=Date)](https://star-history.com/#jason5ng32/MyIP&Date)

## üëÄ ‰∏ªË¶ÅÂäüËÉΩ * üõú **ÁúãËá™Â∑±ÁöÑ IP**Ôºö‰ªéÂ§ö‰∏™ IPv4 Âíå IPv6 Êù•Ê∫êÊ£ÄÊµãÊòæÁ§∫Êú¨Êú∫ÁöÑ IP * üîç **Êü•‰ªªÊÑè IP ‰ø°ÊÅØ**ÔºöÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÂ∞èÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Êü•ËØ¢‰ªªÊÑè IP ÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØ * üïµÔ∏è **Áúã IP ‰ø°ÊÅØ**ÔºöÊòæÁ§∫ÊâÄÊúâ IP ÁöÑÁõ∏ÂÖ≥‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÂåÖÊã¨ÂõΩÂÆ∂„ÄÅÂú∞Âå∫„ÄÅASN„ÄÅÂú∞ÁêÜ‰ΩçÁΩÆÁ≠â * üö¶ **ÂèØÁî®ÊÄßÊ£ÄÊµã**ÔºöÊ£ÄÊµã‰∏Ä‰∫õÁΩëÁ´ôÁöÑÂèØÁî®ÊÄßÔºöGoogle, Github, Youtube, ÁΩëÊòì, ÁôæÂ∫¶Á≠â * üö• **WebRTC Ê£ÄÊµã**ÔºöÊü•Áúã‰ΩøÁî® WebRTC ËøûÊé•Êó∂‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑ IP * üõë **DNS Ê≥ÑÈú≤Ê£ÄÊµã**ÔºöÊü•Áúã DNS Âá∫Âè£‰ø°ÊÅØÔºå‰ª•‰æøÊü•ÁúãÂú® VPN/‰ª£ÁêÜÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÊòØÂê¶Â≠òÂú® DNS Ê≥ÑÈú≤ÈöêÁßÅÁöÑÈ£éÈô© * üöÄ **ÁΩëÈÄüÊµãËØï**ÔºöÂà©Áî®ËæπÁºòÁΩëÁªúËøõË°åÁΩëÈÄüÊµãËØï * üöè **‰ª£ÁêÜËßÑÂàôÊµãËØï**ÔºöÈÖçÂêà‰ª£ÁêÜËΩØ‰ª∂ÁöÑËßÑÂàôËÆæÁΩÆÔºåÊµãËØïËßÑÂàôËÆæÁΩÆÊòØÂê¶Ê≠£Â∏∏ * ‚è±Ô∏è **ÂÖ®ÁêÉÂª∂ËøüÊµãËØï**Ôºö‰ªéÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂú®ÂÖ®ÁêÉÁöÑÂ§ö‰∏™ÊúçÂä°Âô®ËøõË°åÂª∂ËøüÊµãËØïÔºå‰∫ÜËß£‰Ω†‰∏éÂÖ®ÁêÉÁΩëÁªúÁöÑËøûÊé•ÈÄüÂ∫¶ * üì° **MTR ÊµãËØï**Ôºö‰ªéÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂú®ÂÖ®ÁêÉÁöÑÂ§ö‰∏™ÊúçÂä°Âô®ËøõË°å MTR ÊµãËØïÔºå‰∫ÜËß£‰Ω†‰∏éÂÖ®ÁêÉÁöÑËøûÊé•Ë∑ØÂæÑ * üî¶ **DNS Ëß£ÊûêÂô®**Ôºö‰ªéÂ§ö‰∏™Ê∏†ÈÅìÂØπÂüüÂêçËøõË°å DNS Ëß£ÊûêÔºåËé∑ÂèñÂÆûÊó∂ÁöÑËß£ÊûêÁªìÊûúÔºåÂèØÁî®‰∫éÊ±°ÊüìÂà§Êñ≠ * üöß **Â∞ÅÈîÅÊµãËØï**ÔºöÊ£ÄÊü•ÁâπÂÆöÁöÑÁΩëÁ´ôÂú®ÈÉ®ÂàÜÂõΩÂÆ∂ÊòØÂê¶Ë¢´Â∞ÅÈîÅ * üìì **Whois Êü•ËØ¢**ÔºöÂØπÂüüÂêçÊàñ IP ËøõË°å whois ‰ø°ÊÅØÊü•ËØ¢ * üìÄ **MAC Âú∞ÂùÄÊü•ËØ¢**ÔºöÊü•ËØ¢Áâ©ÁêÜÂú∞ÂùÄÁöÑÂΩíÂ±û‰ø°ÊÅØ * üñ•Ô∏è **ÊµèËßàÂô®ÊåáÁ∫π**ÔºöÂ§öÁßçÊñπÂºèÊü•ÁúãÊµèËßàÂô®ÊåáÁ∫π * üìã **ÁΩëÁªúÂÆâÂÖ®Ê£ÄÊü•Ê∏ÖÂçï**Ôºö‰∏ÄÂÖ±Êúâ 258 È°πÁöÑÔºåÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑÁΩëÁªúÂÆâÂÖ®Ê£ÄÊü•Ê∏ÖÂçï ## üí™ ÂêåÊó∂ËøòÊîØÊåÅ * üåó **ÊöóÈªëÊ®°Âºè**ÔºöÊ†πÊçÆÁ≥ªÁªüËÆæÁΩÆËá™Âä®ÂàáÊç¢ÊöóÈªë/ÁôΩÂ§©Ê®°ÂºèÔºå‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÊâãÂä®ÂàáÊç¢ * üì± **ÁÆÄÁ∫¶Ê®°Âºè**Ôºö‰∏∫ÁßªÂä®ÁâàÊèê‰æõÁöÑ‰∏ìÈó®Ê®°ÂºèÔºåÁº©Áü≠È°µÈù¢ÈïøÂ∫¶ÔºåÂø´ÈÄüÊü•ÁúãÊúÄÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØ * üì≤ **ÊîØÊåÅ PWA**ÔºöÂèØ‰ª•Ê∑ªÂä†‰∏∫ÊâãÊú∫Â∫îÁî®‰ª•ÂèäÁîµËÑëÈáåÁöÑÊ°åÈù¢Â∫îÁî®ÔºåÊñπ‰æø‰ΩøÁî® * ‚å®Ô∏è **ÊîØÊåÅÂø´Êç∑ÈîÆ**ÔºöÂèØ‰ª•ÈöèÊó∂ËæìÂÖ• `?` Êü•ÁúãÂø´Êç∑ÈîÆËèúÂçï * üåç Ê†πÊçÆÂèØÁî®ÊÄßÊ£ÄÊµãÁªìÊûúÔºåËøîÂõûÁõÆÂâçÊòØÂê¶ÂèØ‰ª•ËÆøÈóÆÂÖ®‰∏ñÁïåÁΩëÁªúÁöÑÊèêÁ§∫ * üá∫üá∏ üá®üá≥ üá´üá∑ ÊîØÊåÅ‰∏≠Êñá„ÄÅËã±Êñá„ÄÅÊ≥ïÊñá ## üìï Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî® ### Âú® Node ÁéØÂ¢ÉÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ Á°Æ‰øù‰Ω†Á≥ªÁªüÈáåÂ∑≤ÁªèÊúâ Node.js ÁéØÂ¢É„ÄÇ ÂÖãÈöÜ‰ª£Á†Å: ```bash git clone https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP.git ``` ÂÆâË£Ö‰∏éÁºñËØë: ```bash npm install && npm run build ``` ËøêË°å: ```bash npm start ``` Á®ãÂ∫è‰ºöËøêË°åÂú® 18966 Á´ØÂè£„ÄÇ ### ‰ΩøÁî® Docker ÁÇπÂáªÈ°∂ÈÉ®ÁöÑÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âà∞ Docker ÊåâÈíÆÔºåÂç≥ÂèØÂÆåÊàêÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ÔºåÂèàÊàñËÄÖÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ËæìÂÖ•‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§Ôºö ```bash docker run -d -p 18966:18966 --name myip --restart always jason5ng32/myip:latest ``` ## üìö ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáè ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰∏çÊ∑ªÂä†ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáèÁõ¥Êé•‰ΩøÁî®Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊÉ≥‰ΩøÁî®‰∏Ä‰∫õÈ´òÁ∫ßÂäüËÉΩÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Ê∑ªÂä†‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáèÔºö | ÂèòÈáèÂêç | ÊòØÂê¶ÂøÖÈ°ª | ÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº | ËØ¥Êòé | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `BACKEND_PORT` | Âê¶ | `"11966"` | Á®ãÂ∫èÂêéÁ´ØÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑËøêË°åÁ´ØÂè£ | | `FRONTEND_PORT` | Âê¶ | `"18966"` | Á®ãÂ∫èÂâçÁ´ØÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑËøêË°åÁ´ØÂè£ | | `SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT` | Âê¶ | `"0"` | ÊéßÂà∂ÊØè 60 ÂàÜÈíü‰∏Ä‰∏™ IP ÂèØ‰ª•ÂØπÂêéÁ´ØÊúçÂä°Âô®ËØ∑Ê±ÇÁöÑÊ¨°Êï∞ÔºàËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫ 0 Âàô‰∏∫‰∏çÈôêÂà∂Ôºâ | | `SECURITY_DELAY_AFTER` | Âê¶ | `"0"` | ÊéßÂà∂ÊØè 20 ÂàÜÈíü‰∏Ä‰∏™ IP ÁöÑÂâç X Ê¨°ËØ∑Ê±Ç‰∏çÂèóÈÄüÂ∫¶ÈôêÂà∂ÔºåË∂ÖËøá X Ê¨°Âêé‰ºöÈÄêÊ¨°Â¢ûÂä†Âª∂Ëøü | | `SECURITY_BLACKLIST_LOG_FILE_PATH` | Âê¶ | `"logs/blacklist-ip.log"` | Ë∑ØÂæÑËÆæÁΩÆ„ÄÇËÆ∞ÂΩïÁî± SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT ÂºÄÂêØÂêéÔºåËß¶ÂèëÈôêÂà∂ÁöÑ IP ÂàóË°® | | `GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY=` | Âê¶ | `""` | Google Âú∞ÂõæÁöÑ API KeyÔºåÁî®‰∫éÂ±ïÁ§∫ IP ÊâÄÂú®Âú∞ÁöÑÂú∞Âõæ | | `ALLOWED_DOMAINS` | Âê¶ | `""` | ÂÖÅËÆ∏ËÆøÈóÆÁöÑÂüüÂêçÔºåÁî®ÈÄóÂè∑ÂàÜÈöîÔºåÁî®‰∫éÈò≤Ê≠¢ÂêéÁ´Ø API Ë¢´Êª•Áî® | | `IPCHECKING_API_KEY` | Âê¶ | `""` | IPCheck.ing ÁöÑ API KeyÔºåÁî®‰∫éËé∑ÂèñÁ≤æÂáÜÁöÑ IP ÂΩíÂ±ûÂú∞‰ø°ÊÅØ | | `IPINFO_API_TOKEN` | Âê¶ | `""` | IPInfo.io ÁöÑ API TokenÔºåÁî®‰∫éÈÄöËøá IPInfo.io Ëé∑Âèñ IP ÂΩíÂ±ûÂú∞‰ø°ÊÅØ | | `IPAPIIS_API_KEY` | Âê¶ | `""` | IPAPI.is ÁöÑ API KeyÔºåÁî®‰∫éÈÄöËøá IPAPI.is Ëé∑Âèñ IP ÂΩíÂ±ûÂú∞‰ø°ÊÅØ | | `KEYCDN_USER_AGENT` | Âê¶ | `""` | ‰ΩøÁî® KeyCDN Êó∂ÁöÑÂüüÂêçÔºåÈúÄÂåÖÂê´ https ÂâçÁºÄ„ÄÇÁî®‰∫éÈÄöËøá KeyCDN Ëé∑Âèñ IP ÂΩíÂ±ûÂú∞‰ø°ÊÅØ | | `CLOUDFLARE_API` | Âê¶ | `""` | Cloudflare ÁöÑ API KeyÔºåÁî®‰∫éÈÄöËøá Cloudflare Ëé∑Âèñ AS Á≥ªÁªüÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØ | | `MAC_LOOKUP_API_KEY` | Âê¶ | `""` | MAC Êü•ËØ¢ÁöÑ API KeyÔºåÁî®‰∫éÈÄöËøá MAC Lookup Ëé∑Âèñ MAC Âú∞ÂùÄÁöÑÂΩíÂ±û‰ø°ÊÅØ | | `VITE_GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_ID` | **ÊòØ** | `""` | Google Analytics ÁöÑ IDÔºåÁî®‰∫éÁªüËÆ°ËÆøÈóÆÈáè | | `VITE_CURL_IPV4_DOMAIN` | Âê¶ | `""` | ‰∏∫Áî®Êà∑Êèê‰æõ CURL API ÁöÑ IPv4 ÂüüÂêç | | `VITE_CURL_IPV6_DOMAIN` | Âê¶ | `""` | ‰∏∫Áî®Êà∑Êèê‰æõ CURL API ÁöÑ IPv6 ÂüüÂêç | | `VITE_CURL_IPV64_DOMAIN` | Âê¶ | `""` | ‰∏∫Áî®Êà∑Êèê‰æõ CURL API ÁöÑÂèåÁΩëÁªúÊ†àÂüüÂêç | ÈúÄË¶ÅÊ≥®ÊÑèÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú CURL Á≥ªÂàóÁöÑÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáè‰ªªÊÑè‰∏Ä‰∏™Áº∫Â§±ÔºåÈÉΩ‰∏ç‰ºöÂêØÁî® CURL API„ÄÇ ### Âú® Node ÁéØÂ¢ÉÈáå‰ΩøÁî®ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáè ÂàõÂª∫ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáèÔºö ```bash cp .env.example .env ``` ‰øÆÊîπ `.env` ÈáåÁöÑÂÜÖÂÆπÔºåÊØîÂ¶ÇÔºö ```bash BACKEND_PORT=11966 FRONTEND_PORT=18966 GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY="YOUR_KEY_HERE" ALLOWED_DOMAINS="example.com" IPCHECKING_API="YOUR_KEY_HERE" ``` ÁÑ∂ÂêéÈáçÊñ∞ÂêØÂä®ÂêéÁ´ØÊúçÂä°„ÄÇ ### Âú® Docker Èáå‰ΩøÁî®ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáè ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ËøêË°å Docker ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáèÔºåÊØîÂ¶ÇÔºö ```bash docker run -d -p 18966:18966 \ -e GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY="YOUR_KEY_HERE" \ -e ALLOWED_DOMAINS="example.com" \ -e IPCHECKING_API="YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" \ --name myip \ jason5ng32/myip:latest ``` ## üë©üèª‚Äçüíª È´òÁ∫ßÁî®Ê≥ï Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Âú®ÈÄöËøá‰ª£ÁêÜ‰∏äÁΩëÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ËÄÉËôëÂú®‰Ω†ÁöÑ‰ª£ÁêÜÈÖçÁΩÆÈáåÔºåÂ¢ûÂä†‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑËßÑÂàôÔºàËØ∑Ê†πÊçÆ‰Ω†‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØËøõË°å‰øÆÊîπÔºâÔºåËøôÊ†∑Â∞±ÂèØ‰ª•ÂÆûÁé∞ÂêåÊó∂Êü•ËØ¢ÁúüÂÆû IP Âíå‰ª£ÁêÜÂêéÁöÑ IPÔºö ```ini # IP Testing IP-CIDR,1.0.0.1/32,Proxy,no-resolve IP-CIDR6,2606:4700:4700::1111/128,Proxy,no-resolve DOMAIN,4.ipcheck.ing,DIRECT DOMAIN,6.ipcheck.ing,DIRECT # Rule Testing DOMAIN,ptest-1.ipcheck.ing,Proxy1 DOMAIN,ptest-2.ipcheck.ing,Proxy2 DOMAIN,ptest-3.ipcheck.ing,Proxy3 DOMAIN,ptest-4.ipcheck.ing,Proxy4 DOMAIN,ptest-5.ipcheck.ing,Proxy5 DOMAIN,ptest-6.ipcheck.ing,Proxy6 DOMAIN,ptest-7.ipcheck.ing,Proxy7 DOMAIN,ptest-8.ipcheck.ing,Proxy8 ``` ## üò∂‚Äçüå´Ô∏è È¢ùÂ§ñËØ¥Êòé Âú® V2.0 ÂèëÂ∏ÉÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÊàëÊõæÁªèËØ¥ÔºöËøô‰∏™Á®ãÂ∫èÁöÑ 70% ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†Å‰∏çÊòØÊàëÂÜôÁöÑÔºåÊòØÈÄöËøá ChatGPT ÂÜôÁöÑ„ÄÇÂ§ßÊ¶ÇÊù•Âõû 90 ‰∏™ÂõûÂêàÔºåÂ§ñÂä†‰∏Ä‰∫õÁªÜÂæÆÁöÑÊâãÂä®‰øÆÊîπÔºåÂÆåÊàê‰∫ÜÂÖ®ÈÉ®‰ª£Á†Å„ÄÇ ÂΩìÁÑ∂ÔºåÁ®ãÂ∫èÁöÑÊû∂ÊûÑÂíå UI ËøòÊòØÈúÄË¶ÅËá™Â∑±ËøõË°åËÆæËÆ°„ÄÇ ÈöèÁùÄ V3.0 ÂèäÂêéÁª≠ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÂèëÂ∏ÉÔºåChatGPT Â∏ÆÂä©ÊàëÂÜô‰ª£Á†ÅÁöÑÊØî‰æãÈÄêÊ∏ê‰∏ãÈôçÔºå‰º∞ËÆ°Áé∞Âú®Âú® 40% - 50% ‰πãÈó¥„ÄÇÁõ∏ÂèçÔºåÂú®Ëøô‰∏™ËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ªéÂÆåÂÖ®‰∏ç‰ºö JavaScript Âíå Vue Ôºå‰∏é AI ÁªìÂØπÁºñÁ®ãÂêéÔºåÊàëÁé∞Âú®Â∑≤ÁªèËÉΩÁúãÊáÇÂ§ßÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑ JS ‰ª£Á†Å‰∫ÜÔºåÂπ∂‰∏î‰πüÂ∑≤ÁªèËÉΩÊâãÊí∏‰∏Ä‰∫õ„ÄÇ ÊÑüË∞¢ AI ÔºåÁªô‰∫ÜÊàëËøôÊ†∑‰∏Ä‰∏™Â§±‰∏ö‰∫ßÂìÅÁªèÁêÜÂø´ÈÄüÂ≠¶‰π†ÁºñÁ®ãÁöÑÊú∫‰ºö„ÄÇ ## üåü Star History [![Star History files.name: SECURITY.md
files.content:
## Reporting a Vulnerability

The security of our project is a top priority. If you discover a security vulnerability, we encourage you to report it directly through our GitHub Issues.

### How to Report a Vulnerability

1. **Report Through GitHub Issues**: Please create a new issue in our [GitHub Issues page](https://github.com/jason5ng32/MyIP/issues). Provide a clear and detailed description of the potential vulnerability. Include steps to reproduce it, if possible.

2. **Avoid Public Disclosure**: To protect the community, please do not disclose the vulnerability publicly until we have had a chance to address it.

3. **Response Time**: We aim to respond to security issue reports within 48 hours, acknowledging receipt.

4. **Updates**: We will keep you informed about our progress on the issue through the GitHub Issues thread.

5. **Credit**: We value your contribution to the security of this project. We will acknowledge your efforts in the GitHub Issue thread and in our release notes, if a fix is implemented.

## Security Update Process

Upon receiving a report of a vulnerability, our team will:

- Promptly investigate the issue.
- Develop a fix and test it thoroughly.
- Release an updated version that addresses the issue.
- Provide updates and patches as needed.

Thank you for helping us keep our project safe and secure.

files.name: backend-server.js
docker-compose.yml
files.content:
# docker-compose up -d
version: '3'
services:
    myip:
        container_name: myip
        image: jason5ng32/myip:latest # my-app: x.x.x
        stdin_open: true # docker run -i ‰∫§‰∫íÊ®°Âºè
        tty: true        # docker run -t ÁªàÁ´ØÊ®°Âºè
        restart: always # ÈáçÂêØÁ≠ñÁï• / on-failure:5 ÈáçÂêØÊ¨°Êï∞5Ê¨° / always ‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÈáçÂêØ / unless-stopped Èô§ÈùûÂÅúÊ≠¢ / no ‰ªé‰∏çÈáçÂêØ
        ports:
            - "18966:18966"

package.json
files.content:
{
  "name": "myip",
  "private": true,
  "version": "4.0.0",
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "concurrently \"vite\" \"nodemon backend-server.js\"",
    "build": "vite build",
    "preview": "vite preview",
    "start-backend": "node backend-server.js",
    "start-frontend": "node frontend-server.js",
    "start": "concurrently \"npm run start-frontend\" \"npm run start-backend\""
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@analytics/google-analytics": "^1.1.0",
    "@cloudflare/speedtest": "^1.3.0",
    "@khmyznikov/pwa-install": "^0.4.8",

    "analytics": "^0.8.16",

    "bootstrap-icons": "^1.11.3",
    "circle-progress.vue": "^3.3.0",
    "code-inspector-plugin": "^0.18.3",
    "concurrently": "^9.1.0",
    "country-code-lookup": "^0.1.3",
    "detect-gpu": "^5.0.62",
    "dotenv": "^16.4.7",
    "express": "^4.21.2",
    "express-rate-limit": "^7.5.0",
    "express-slow-down": "^2.0.3",
    "flag-icons": "^7.2.3",
    "http-proxy-middleware": "^3.0.3",
    "maxmind": "^4.3.23",
    "nodemon": "^3.1.9",
    "pinia": "^2.3.0",
    "svgmap": "^2.12.1",
    "ua-parser-js": "^2.0.0",
    "vue": "^3.5.13",
    "vue-i18n": "^11.0.0",
    "vue-markdown-render": "^2.2.1",
    "vue-router": "^4.5.0",
    "whoiser": "^1.18.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@vitejs/plugin-vue": "^5.2.1",
    "vite": "^6.0.5",
    "vite-plugin-pwa": "^0.21.1"
  }
}
